page.title: 07Jobs
page.content: Most women in our area are housewives, although a lot of farmer's wives work on the farm as well, helping with milking and lambing. Some women also work in the NAAFI at the army camp in Warcop. Most men work on the farms or on jobs connected with farming, because there is no other industry in our area. Some travel to work in other towns like Appleby and Penrith or Kendal. A few work at a Gypsum mine further down the valley. Many young people have to move out of our area to live and work in towns. There are some people with unusual jobs like the blacksmith, the signwriter, and the old peoples' home warden.
